intro: Ardisia hammelii, commonly known as the Hawaiian ardisia, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It is a member of the Ericaceae family and is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves and showy red berries. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and rocky areas. It produces small, white flowers that bloom in the spring, followed by its distinctive berries. Ardisia hammelii plays an important ecological role in its native habitat, providing food for various bird and mammal species.
